meanings.sent1: She took the pain relief medication preheadache to prevent any discomfort.
meanings.sent2: He always drinks water preheadache to stay hydrated and avoid headaches.
meanings.sent3: The hiker packed snacks preheadache, knowing a headache would ruin the adventure.
meanings.sent4: The early morning clouds were a preheadache warning of the storm to come.
meanings.sent5: The preheadache stretching routine helped her relax and prevent tension headaches.

meanings.definition: A symptom that precedes a headache.
meanings.sent1: Her preheadache was a throbbing sensation behind her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The doctor asked about any preheadaches to understand the headache triggers.
meanings.sent3: His preheadache was like a tiny drummer practicing for the main event.
meanings.sent4: The preheadache was a red flag warning of the impending headache storm.
meanings.sent5: The preheadache aura made her reach for her migraine medication in advance.
